TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IBindingDeliveryCapabilities

remarks.para: The interface must be implemented by a binding if clients and services are to be able to stipulate, as part of their contract, that the features they require are provided by the binding.

summary.para: Defines the interface that bindings must implement to describe and advertise the capabilities that clients and services may require.

remarks.para: The value of this property is consumed by the when the description of the service is loaded at runtime. This check is done to determine whether the ordered delivery requirements of the service are satisfied by the binding selected or created for the service.

summary.para: Gets a value that indicates whether the binding can support assurances for the delivery of messages in the order they were sent.

remarks.para: The value of this property is consumed when the description of the service is loaded at runtime. This check is done to determine whether the queued delivery requirements of the service are satisfied by the binding selected or created for the service.

summary.para: Gets a value that indicates whether the binding can support the queued delivery of messages.
